content: How did you create this backup? Thunderbird doesn't create backups on its own. If you created a new profile, the old one should be in the Profiles folder at c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles
creator: davidsk

content: It may help to see screenshots of your 'copies&folders' pane for each account. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: Check the online account to confirm that the messages are being deleted. If so, then the PC is likely a POP setup that is downloading and leaving on server. A check of the setup will clarify this.
creator: davidsk

content: Hi David. Thanks for the quick response. Unfortunately it hasn't resolved the problem. I have 2 email accounts, both of which are IMAP Mail Servers. This has been the case for many years now. It's only in the last few months that deleting emails from my phone hasn't deleted them from the laptop. Nothing has changed as far as I know. Maybe there's been a recent Mozilla update (which I probably will have applied). ðŸ¤”
creator: hallbrian5745

content: Hello again David Since I posted around 10 mins ago my phone has started to delete emails from the laptop. I've tried single and multiple deletions on the phone and they all delete from the main pc/laptop. It's a bit of a mystery but, on the principle of - if it ain't broke don't fix it - I'm going to post it as solved. Thanks again for your prompt. Regards Brian
creator: hallbrian5745

content: Seeing a screenshot of the account folders within the imapmail and mail folders may help. Sometimes, compacting fails and leaves detritus that can be readily removed. I make that request because my inference is that the large disk usage is due to the accounts,
creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks - see below.

In one of the "Completed Emails.sbd folders there is one file - nstmp-1 - which is 657.1Gb.

What the hell is this, and what is it doing here?
creator: tim292

content: nstmp files are the detritus remains of an attempted compaction that failed. Just delete. I was anticipating this. If you have very large message folders, this may happen periodically,
creator: davidsk

content: Brilliant, thanks David. I've now got a hard drive with enough space on it to start work again.
creator: tim292
